item.title: Russ add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Russ add a quote by Kobayashi Issa
item.description: "Summer night-- even the stars are whispering to each other." -- Kobayashi Issa

item.title: Russ add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Russ add a quote by Carlos Fuentes
item.description: "I need, therefore I imagine." -- Carlos Fuentes

item.title: Russ add a quote by St. Francis Of Assisi
item.description: "All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle." -- St. Francis Of Assisi

item.title: Russ add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Once you learn to read, you will be forever free." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Russ add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Russ add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Russ add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "If a thing loves, it is infinite." -- William Blake

item.title: Russ add a quote by Kazuo Ishiguro
item.description: "Memories, even your most precious ones, fade surprisingly quickly. But I don’t go along with that. The memories I value most, I don’t ever see them fading." -- Kazuo Ishiguro

item.title: Russ add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "Finally, from so little sleeping and so much reading, his brain dried up and he went completely out of his mind." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Russ add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Russ add a quote by Émile Zola
item.description: "If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud." -- Émile Zola

item.title: Russ add a quote by Baltasar Gracian
item.description: "Never open the door to a lesser evil, for other and greater ones invariably slink in after it." -- Baltasar Gracian

item.title: Russ add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Russ add a quote by Osip Mandelstam
item.description: "My turn shall also come: I sense the spreading of a wing." -- Osip Mandelstam

item.title: Russ add a quote by Richard Brinsley Sheridan
item.description: "Never say more than is necessary." -- Richard Brinsley Sheridan

item.title: Russ add a quote by Louis Adamic
item.description: "My grandfather always said that living is like licking honey off a thorn." -- Louis Adamic

item.title: Russ add a quote by Dan Brown
item.description: "Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer." -- Dan Brown

item.title: Russ add a quote by Gilda Radner
item.description: "I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end." -- Gilda Radner

item.title: Russ add a quote by Don Carpenter
item.description: "I consider my work optimistic in that the people, during the period I’m writing about them, are experiencing intense emotion. It is my belief that this is all there is to it." -- Don Carpenter
